@@ -0,0 +1,187 @@
+<!--
+
+    Copyright 2020 Smart Society Services B.V.
+
+    Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+
+        http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+
+-->
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+
+    <artifactId>osgp-secret-management</artifactId>
+    <name>osgp-secret-management</name>
+    <packaging>war</packaging>
+    <description>Secret management module.</description>
+
+    <parent>
+        <groupId>org.opensmartgridplatform</groupId>
+        <artifactId>parent-platform</artifactId>
+        <version>5.2.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
+        <relativePath>../parent-platform/pom.xml</relativePath>
+    </parent>
+
+    <properties>
+        <java.version>1.8</java.version>
+        <spring.boot.version>2.2.2.RELEASE</spring.boot.version>
+        <jaxb.plugin.version>2.5.0</jaxb.plugin.version>
+        <build.helper.maven.plugin.version>3.0.0</build.helper.maven.plugin.version>
+        <apache.ws.xlmschema.version>2.0.1</apache.ws.xlmschema.version>
+        <logback.spring.extensions.version>0.1.5</logback.spring.extensions.version>
+        <wsdl4j.version>1.6.3</wsdl4j.version>
+        <maven.failsafe.plugin.version>3.0.0-M4</maven.failsafe.plugin.version>
+        <spring.boot.maven.plugin.version>2.2.2.RELEASE</spring.boot.maven.plugin.version>
+        <failOnMissingWebXml>false</failOnMissingWebXml>
+        <osgp-ws-secret-management-version>5.2.0-SNAPSHOT</osgp-ws-secret-management-version>
+    </properties>
+
+    <build>
+        <plugins>
+            <plugin>
+                <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
+                <artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
+                <version>${spring.boot.maven.plugin.version}</version>
+            </plugin>
+            <plugin>
+                <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId>
+                <artifactId>build-helper-maven-plugin</artifactId>
+                <version>${build.helper.maven.plugin.version}</version>
+                <executions>
+                    <execution>
+                        <id>add-integration-test-source</id>
+                        <phase>generate-test-sources</phase>
+                        <goals>
+                            <goal>add-test-source</goal>
+                        </goals>
+                        <configuration>
+                            <sources>
+                                <source>src/integration-test/java</source>
+                            </sources>
+                        </configuration>
+                    </execution>
+                    <execution>
+                        <id>add-test-resource</id>
+                        <phase>generate-test-sources</phase>
+                        <goals>
+                            <goal>add-test-resource</goal>
+                        </goals>
+                        <configuration>
+                            <resources>
+                                <resource>
+                                    <directory>src/integration-test/resources</directory>
+                                </resource>
+                            </resources>
+                        </configuration>
+                    </execution>
+                </executions>
+            </plugin>
+
+            <plugin>
+                <artifactId>maven-failsafe-plugin</artifactId>
+                <version>${maven.failsafe.plugin.version}</version>
+                <executions>
+                    <execution>
+                        <goals>
+                            <goal>integration-test</goal>
+                            <goal>verify</goal>
+                        </goals>
+                    </execution>
+                </executions>
+            </plugin>
+        </plugins>
+    </build>
+
+    <dependencies>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
+            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-web</artifactId>
+            <version>${spring.boot.version}</version>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
+            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-web-services</artifactId>
+            <version>${spring.boot.version}</version>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
+            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-data-jpa</artifactId>
+            <version>${spring.boot.version}</version>
+        </dependency>
+
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>org.projectlombok</groupId>
+            <artifactId>lombok</artifactId>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>org.opensmartgridplatform</groupId>
+            <artifactId>shared</artifactId>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>org.opensmartgridplatform</groupId>
+            <artifactId>osgp-ws-secret-management</artifactId>
+            <version>${osgp-ws-secret-management-version}</version>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>wsdl4j</groupId>
+            <artifactId>wsdl4j</artifactId>
+            <version>${wsdl4j.version}</version>
+        </dependency>
+
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>org.apache.ws.xmlschema</groupId>
+            <artifactId>xmlschema-core</artifactId>
+            <version>${apache.ws.xlmschema.version}</version>
+        </dependency>
+
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>javax.jms</groupId>
+            <artifactId>javax.jms-api</artifactId>
+            <version>2.0.1</version>

+<!--

+    Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at

+         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+
+    <artifactId>osgp-secret-management</artifactId>
+    <name>osgp-secret-management</name>
+    <packaging>war</packaging>
+    <description>Secret management module.</description>
+
+    <parent>
+        <groupId>org.opensmartgridplatform</groupId>
+        <artifactId>parent-platform</artifactId>
+        <version>5.2.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
+        <relativePath>../parent-platform/pom.xml</relativePath>
+    </parent>

+        <java.version>1.8</java.version>
+        <spring.boot.version>2.2.2.RELEASE</spring.boot.version>
+        <jaxb.plugin.version>2.5.0</jaxb.plugin.version>

+        <apache.ws.xlmschema.version>2.0.1</apache.ws.xlmschema.version>

+        <wsdl4j.version>1.6.3</wsdl4j.version>
+        <maven.failsafe.plugin.version>3.0.0-M4</maven.failsafe.plugin.version>
+        <spring.boot.maven.plugin.version>2.2.2.RELEASE</spring.boot.maven.plugin.version>
+        <failOnMissingWebXml>false</failOnMissingWebXml>
+        <osgp-ws-secret-management-version>5.2.0-SNAPSHOT</osgp-ws-secret-management-version>
+    </properties>
+
+    <build>
+        <plugins>
+            <plugin>
+                <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
+                <artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
+                <version>${spring.boot.maven.plugin.version}</version>
+            </plugin>
+            <plugin>
+                <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId>
+                <artifactId>build-helper-maven-plugin</artifactId>
+                <version>${build.helper.maven.plugin.version}</version>
+                <executions>
+                    <execution>
+                        <id>add-integration-test-source</id>
+                        <phase>generate-test-sources</phase>
+                        <goals>
+                            <goal>add-test-source</goal>
+                        </goals>
+                        <configuration>
+                            <sources>
+                                <source>src/integration-test/java</source>
+                            </sources>
+                        </configuration>
+                    </execution>
+                    <execution>
+                        <id>add-test-resource</id>
+                        <phase>generate-test-sources</phase>
+                        <goals>
+                            <goal>add-test-resource</goal>
+                        </goals>
+                        <configuration>
+                            <resources>
+                                <resource>
+                                    <directory>src/integration-test/resources</directory>
+                                </resource>
+                            </resources>
+                        </configuration>
+                    </execution>
+                </executions>
+            </plugin>
+
+            <plugin>
+                <artifactId>maven-failsafe-plugin</artifactId>
+                <version>${maven.failsafe.plugin.version}</version>
+                <executions>
+                    <execution>
+                        <goals>
+                            <goal>integration-test</goal>
+                            <goal>verify</goal>
+                        </goals>
+                    </execution>
+                </executions>
+            </plugin>
+        </plugins>
+    </build>
+
+    <dependencies>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
+            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-web</artifactId>
+            <version>${spring.boot.version}</version>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
+            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-web-services</artifactId>
+            <version>${spring.boot.version}</version>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
+            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-data-jpa</artifactId>
+            <version>${spring.boot.version}</version>
+        </dependency>
+
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>org.projectlombok</groupId>
+            <artifactId>lombok</artifactId>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>org.opensmartgridplatform</groupId>
+            <artifactId>shared</artifactId>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>org.opensmartgridplatform</groupId>
+            <artifactId>osgp-ws-secret-management</artifactId>
+            <version>${osgp-ws-secret-management-version}</version>
+        </dependency>
+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>wsdl4j</groupId>
+            <artifactId>wsdl4j</artifactId>
+            <version>${wsdl4j.version}</version>

+
+        <dependency>

+            <artifactId>postgresql</artifactId>
+            <scope>runtime</scope>

+        <dependency>
+            <groupId>com.h2database</groupId>
+            <artifactId>h2</artifactId>
+            <version>1.4.200</version>

nodes.bodyText:
this seems confusing. Can these file ever be null?
in case any of the files is null, the Provider does not work, correct ? RSA does not work unless both keys are in order.
these can be final I think?
Why check on null if this would never be the case? consider rewriting the constructor.
I would rewrite this into several methods:
are these constants used on other classes? If not, make private
why not create a SecretKey class with a constuctor and use Lombok ?
I think all these values can be private
I would consider creating a super constructor with the Key File instead of a setter, to make the values immutable
this else could be removed, just return false.
remove?
remove ?
why not use the Secret class here? it already has the byte array
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,32 @@
+/**
+ * Copyright 2020 Smart Society Services B.V.
+ *
+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+ * with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+ *
+ * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+ */
+package org.opensmartgridplatform.shared.security;
+
+/**
+ * Secret class to store any binary encrypted secret. The secret can be anything.
+ * A secret contains the type of encryption provider that was used to encrypt it.
+ * There is no encoding/decoding.
+ */
+public class EncryptedSecret {
+    private final byte[] secret;

nodes.bodyText: I think this line and the next can be combined into one.
could be one liner
why is this an array parameter and not a List ?

I would consider removing the year and month from the schema. this doesn't add anything and will only cause confusion.
Unless of course we want to be backwards compatible with other client, but I doubt that will happen soon

nodes.bodyText: I don't think you need this qualifier, there is only one bean named SecretManagementService
move this autowired to constructor injection.
I don;t understand why the class is SecurityKeyService, why not inject the SecretManagementService ?
change to constructor injection
@slf4j
dit kom meerdere keren voor. dit moet allemaal veranderen in SecretManagementService injection, die qualifier kan weg
formatting not applied ?
params kunnen final zijn
final ?
dit hoeft niet, de naam is al goed. het is al secretManagementService
use @slf4j
dit is obscuur IMO, je gooit de optional met een elseThrow mee als parameter. Ik zou dit iets explicieter maken door een ifPresent oid te schrijven
dit lijkt me niet goed. een snapshot versie opnemen in de properties file
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -27,6 +27,7 @@
 
   <properties>
     <display.version>${project.version}-${BUILD_TAG}</display.version>
+    <osgp-ws-secret-management-version>5.2.0-SNAPSHOT</osgp-ws-secret-management-version>

nodes.bodyText: SOME_DEVICE zou constant kunnen zijn
minor: could all be private
we removed all context.xml files from our WAR projects. I think this needs to removed and added externally
what could go wrong here?
could be rewritten with Optional?

this seems strange, why do a null check here?
consider doing the null check in the caller, that is much clearer.

and another null check?
consider validating the DbEncryptedSecret  first before calling this method

I see many IllegalStateExceptions, although it is easy/handy to throw just a RuntimeException I would suggest to make a proper Checked Exception to make it more explicit where it can go wrong and improved exception handling.

I would rewrite this into a constructor to make data immutable.
also it is much less lines. just return new DbEncryptedSecret(value1, value2) etc
where is the NoSuchElementException exception thrown?
I would rewrite this to make it clearer
this annotation is not needed
possible NPE's here?
you could use Stream().map() here
could use Stream().map()
I would keep the endpoint as thin as possible and move away the "secrets"code to the service.

why is this class prepended with Db (I understand why, but it is not standard to the rest of the app).
Consider changing to EncryptionKeyReference, then you also do not need the name attribute of @table
remove the Db and name attributes from the annotation

is this possible? for RSA you need both the public key and the private key, They should never be able to be null.
I would rewrite this to fail the deployment / startup when any of the keys is null. Or not create this Provider at all if the provider can be absent

can you explain why is this class needed? either the logback.xml from the classpath is loaded or one is provided via the context.xml.
Is there a reason we use JDNI here? is the log file neede by JMX ?
this is a constant, is there a reason why it is a Spring @value ?

nodes.bodyText:
Any exception will be translated to a TechnicalException. Is this intended?
Maybe return a SOAP Fault to communicate the problem to the caller?
See comment above
Make this field final
You could validate this in the caller and assume valid input.
Validate input
This could be done beautifully with the Streams API ;-)
See comments above
This will never be null due to the instance of check  in the above code fragment
+1 for the exception translation
Is there only a generic exception?
I have only seen Component.SHARED be set. What is the relevance of this field?
Is this relevant for the caller?
Is this something you want to expose?
I would not expose the cause. Translate exceptions to application specific ones.
+1 for using the Stream API
Global variables
Make final
I think I wouldn't do this in the constructor. You could create beans and inject the Key objects in here
Global variables
Make final
Make this private, add getter if needed.

return
bytes.length > BLOCK_SIZE
&&
Arrays.stream(Arrays.copyOfRange(bytes, 0, BLOCK_SIZE)).allMatch(b -> b == 0);
Something like this?
final

nodes.bodyText: Spring Boot will override the property logging.config.
Element fileNamePattern has "test" in its value, but element file doesn't.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,30 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<configuration>
+
+  <appender name="CONSOLE" class="ch.qos.logback.core.ConsoleAppender">
+    <encoder>
+      <pattern>%d{yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS}] [${HOSTNAME}] [%thread] %level %logger{36}@%method:%line - %msg%n</pattern>
+    </encoder>
+  </appender>
+
+  <appender name="FILE" class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender">
+    <file>/var/log/osp/logs/osgp-secret-management.log</file>
+    <rollingPolicy class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.SizeAndTimeBasedRollingPolicy">
+      <fileNamePattern>/var/log/osp/logs/test-osgp-secret-management.log.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.%i.log</fileNamePattern>

nodes.bodyText: Layout: only show one value per line for readability.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,15 @@
+/**
+ * Copyright 2020 Smart Society Services B.V.
+ *
+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+ * with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+ *
+ * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+ */
+package org.opensmartgridplatform.secretmanagement.application.domain;
+
+public enum SecretType {
+    E_METER_MASTER_KEY, E_METER_AUTHENTICATION_KEY, E_METER_ENCRYPTION_KEY_UNICAST, E_METER_ENCRYPTION_KEY_BROADCAST,
+    G_METER_MASTER_KEY, G_METER_ENCRYPTION_KEY, G_METER_FIRMWARE_UPDATE_AUTHENTICATION_KEY, G_METER_OPTICAL_PORT_KEY,
+    PPP_PASSWORD

nodes.bodyText: To be consistent, use Lombok here as well.
Never use printStackTrace.
The method only throws TechnicalExceptions, so why use OsgpException in the throws clause?
We normally use Orika for mapping.
Do not use the "Db" prefix for repositories and entities.

We normally don't use the creation_time (and modification_time) in the code. And we've had some problems in the few places where we did use those columns. Consider using a separate column.
Or would it be possible to just select "max(es.id)" instead of searching the highest creation_time?
When searching a value, both edges (valid_from = :date and valid_to = :date) are excluded. I would expect at least one of those two to be included.
Other databases are created separately from the application code.
The filename doesn't conform to the naming convention. See https://github.com/SmartSocietyServices/Way-of-Working-Wiki/wiki/FlyWay-way-of-working
Indentation is wrong because of using tabs. Replace all tabs by 4 spaces.

+DO
+$$
+      BEGIN
+		 IF NOT EXISTS(

nodes.bodyText: Avoid using the old java.util.Date class. ZonedDateTime is a better one.
Your IDE should be able to format this nicely automatically (the same goes for the previous "@Formatter" code.

commit.message:
Revert "Remove tests for build"

This reverts commit bde1481a55eb7557be924ba8e0129113827c4162.
Disable failing unit tests, solve minor sonar issues

Merge pull request #375 from OSGP/test_2077

Test 2077
Added fix for not finding external logback configuration
Removed file appender for integration test
Add secret management to pom and database

nodes.bodyText: Remove the literal "false" boolean value.

commit.message: Undo groovy change for release branch
Initial version of secret management service and repo's
Removed generate secret method for now
Added encryption/decryption & exception handling to service
Changes resulting from discussion with Erik
Added dynamic encryption provider type key lookup
Changes to accomodate key dereferencing and code cleanup/shuffle
Added repository IT & fixed persistency related problems
Added encryption provider type to repo find method
Moved IT and changed test default to JRE encryption
IT and unit tests (work in progress)
Added test asserts on secret stored to DB
Added expected response (context todo); added test request and response folders
Added repo IT for key repo
SLIM-2077 load keyfile on init and coverage improvents
Fixed bug regarding NOT NULL constraint for creation time
Removed constraint on unique secrets; added check on adding existing (identical) secret; changed retrieval (get latest valid secret)
Fixed bug (regarding incorrect query generation for DB paging) by changing repo query
Fixed inconsistent ITs caused by timing issue in query
Changed repo query (no encryption provider type parameter)

nodes.bodyText: I would expect this to be a Spring Component.
inject as Spring @resource ?
what is "1" , better to create a constant
Spring component ?
warning or error ?
basically returning null is a code-smell. consider returning Optional
basically returning null is a code-smell. consider returning Optional
change to Spring bean and use @resource injection
minor: consider naming interface SecretManagementService and the impl SecretManagementServiceImpl as this is the most common way to do this.
do yo need a native query per se ?
TechnicalServiceFault seems vague. Maybe rename to SecretManagementException or something like that ?
add accolades as per the standard.
I see a lot of hardcoded strings, consider moving to properties as in the rest of OSGP

Note that the DefaultEncryptionDelegate is not a delegate but a Delegator. The actual Delegates are the providers doing the work.
Consider renaming.
this seems a strange construct and not open to extension. Why not create a second Provider for HSM?
for my understanding: is it ever possible that multiple providers for the same EncryptionProviderType are registered?
consider keeping the param names equal to the Object types. EncryptionProviderType --> encType misses "provider" and is thus less readable.

use default value in annotation:
"${component.name:OSGP-SECRET-MANAGEMENT}"
I don't think this should be hardcoded here.
and another version for properties

nodes.bodyText: @propertysource annotations should be placed on Main.class. That class is annotated with @SpringBootApplication and will be loaded before @configuration annotated classes (which need those properties!)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,23 @@
+/**
+ * Copyright 2020 Smart Society Services B.V.
+ *
+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+ * with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+ *
+ * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+ */
+package org.opensmartgridplatform.secretmanagement.application.config;
+
+import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Value;
+import org.springframework.context.annotation.Configuration;
+import org.springframework.context.annotation.PropertySource;
+
+@Configuration
+@PropertySource("classpath:osgp-secret-management.properties")
+@PropertySource(value = "file:${osgp/Global/config}", ignoreResourceNotFound = true)
+@PropertySource(value = "file:${osgp/SecretManagement/config}", ignoreResourceNotFound = true)

nodes.bodyText:
Use @value("${component.name:OSGP-SECRET-MANAGEMENT}") to provide default value.
Also, final fields should be set through constructor only. Best to remove final and I would probably make this field private.
